    • Method Detail

      • offset

        SelectQuery offset(long theOffset)
        Description copied from interface: ReadQuery
        Set the offset of the query results. Similar to ReadQuery.limit(long) this will override an offset in the query, and you can use ReadQuery.NO_OFFSET to remove an offset specified on the query, but not in the query string.
        Specified by:
        offset in interface ReadQuery<org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult>
        Parameters:
        theOffset - the offset
        Returns:
        this query

      • limit

        SelectQuery limit(long theLimit)
        Description copied from interface: ReadQuery
        Set the maximum number of results that can be returned by this query. Setting the limit on the query will override any limit specified in the original query string, however, setting the limit to ReadQuery.NO_LIMIT will not remove the limit if it is specified in the query, but you can use it to remove a limit that has already been set if there was not a limit specified in the query originally.
        Specified by:
        limit in interface ReadQuery<org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult>
        Parameters:
        theLimit - the new limit
        Returns:
        this query

      • reasoning

        SelectQuery reasoning(ReasoningType theReasoningType)
        Specify the type of reasoning you would like the query to be executed with. You can only modify the reasoning level of a query outside of a transaction. If querying within a transaction you can only use the reasoning level associated with the connection.
        Specified by:
        reasoning in interface ReadQuery<org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult>
        Parameters:
        theReasoningType - the reasoning type
        Returns:
        this query
